An Evening of Tibetan Dance & Music

After the Liberty Award ceremony, enjoy an evening of modern and traditional Tibetan dance and music, all for a great cause with proceeds benefiting the Community Center Project of the Tibetan Association of Philadelphia.

Beloved by Tibetans and non-Tibetans alike, actor and comedian Sonam Wangdue will emcee. The evening will feature performances by former members of the highly regarded Tibetan Institute of Performing Arts (TIPA). The group will perform a variety of classical and traditional Tibetan dance and music, such as the Yak Dance, Tibetan Hunter Dance, Tibetan Good Luck Dance, and classical songs.

Performing also will be popular Tibetan modern singer songwriter, Phurbu T. Namgyal, whose most recent YouTube video can be found here. Namgyal has released many albums, loved by Tibetans inside and outside of Tibet. Don’t miss this special evening of music, dance, comedy and more, and all for a great cause!

About the Tibetan Institute for Performing Arts

Based in Dharamsala, India and founded by His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama with aim of preserving Tibetan opera, dance and music, the Tibetan Institute for the Performing Arts is the world’s most prestigious Tibetan dance and music institute in exile. You can view one of their many YouTube videos here.

Benefiting the Cultural Center Project of the Tibetan Association of Philadelphia

All proceeds from the concert will go to the Cultural Center Project of the Tibetan Association of Philadelphia. For information about this event, please contact Sonam Dorji at sonam_d_2000@yahoo.com

Tickets

Adults $25
Children under the age of 10 are free.
Tickets can be purchased at the door, or in advance on Eventbrite.
